medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began after a period of difficulty with breastfeeding, followed by voracious feeding on infant formula. The patient exceeded the 95th percentile for weight at 90 days of age, with rapid weight gain continuing until she weighed 64.4 kg by 5 years of age, leading to a body mass index of 43.4.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of recurrent urinary tract infections, perineal dermatitis, and asthma, which developed at age 2 and required bronchodilators and inhaled corticosteroids.
medical_history.family_history: Mother has systemic lupus erythematosus and hypothyroidism since her early twenties; other relatives are affected with lupus.
